title: Can & Can't: Abilities and Permissions
description: Слушайте простые истории и тренируйте конструкции can и can't в реальных ситуациях.

tasks.audioText: Lisa is at the swimming pool with her friends. She swims fast and does not get tired. She can swim very well.

options.text: She is able to swim very well.
She cannot swim at all.
She is afraid of the water.
She only watches her friends swim.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says she can swim very well. Option 1 repeats this ability; the other options say she cannot swim or does not swim.

tasks.audioText: Tom's friend invites him to a party tonight. Tom has to work late in the office. I can't come to the party tonight.
tasks.transcript: I can't come to the party tonight.

options.text: He is able to go to the party tonight.
He cannot go to the party this evening.
He wants to come to the party tomorrow.
He goes to a party every night.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says he cannot come to the party tonight. Option 2 has the same meaning; the other options say he can go, goes another day, or goes every night.

tasks.audioText: You are in a small cafe with a friend. You ask the waiter about payment. You can pay by card here.
tasks.transcript: You can pay by card here.

options.text: It is possible to pay with a card here.
You must pay only with cash here.
You cannot pay in this cafe.
You pay nothing in this cafe.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says you are allowed to pay by card. Option 1 has the same idea; the other options say you must pay cash, cannot pay, or pay nothing.

tasks.audioText: Anna and Mark stop their car near a big shop. There is a sign with a red line on the street. We can't park the car here.
tasks.transcript: We can't park the car here.

options.text: We are not allowed to leave the car here.
We can leave the car here for free.
We must park the car in this place.
We can sleep in the car here.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says parking here is not allowed. Option 1 repeats this; the other options say parking here is okay or even required, or talk about sleeping in the car.

tasks.audioText: Pablo works in an international company. He uses English, Spanish, and French at work. He can speak three languages.

options.text: He is able to speak three languages.
He can only speak one language.
He studies three languages but cannot speak them.
He reads three books every month.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says he can speak three languages. Option 1 has the same meaning; the other options change the number or talk about reading.

tasks.audioText: Students sit in an English class. There is a rule written on the wall. You can't use your phone in class.
tasks.transcript: You can't use your phone in class.

options.text: You are not allowed to use your phone during class.
You must use your phone for every lesson.
You can use your phone in every class.
You can't bring your books to class.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says using your phone in class is not allowed. Option 1 repeats this rule; the other options say the opposite or talk about books.

tasks.audioText: Your neighbor carries a heavy box up the stairs. He looks at you and speaks politely. Can you help me with this box?
tasks.transcript: Can you help me with this box?

options.text: He is asking you to help with the box.
He is asking you to open the door.
He tells you not to touch the box.
He says the box is empty.

tasks.explanation: The sentence is a request for help with the box. Option 1 explains this; the other options talk about the door, not touching, or the box being empty.

tasks.audioText: A new shop opens in your town. The manager talks about the staff timetable. They can start work at nine.
tasks.transcript: They can start work at nine.

options.text: They are able to begin work at nine.
They have to start work at six.
They cannot start working at nine.
They can finish work at nine.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says nine o'clock is a possible time to start work. Option 1 has the same idea; the other options change the time or say they cannot start then.

tasks.audioText: Maria eats lunch in a restaurant with friends. She tells the waiter about her allergy. I can't eat nuts.

options.text: She is able to eat nuts.
She must eat more nuts.
She cannot eat any nuts.
She only eats nuts for lunch.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says she cannot eat nuts. Option 3 repeats this; the other options say she can or must eat nuts, or eats only nuts.

tasks.audioText: Your friend gives you his phone number. He wants you to contact him when you need help. You can call me any time.
tasks.transcript: You can call me any time.

options.text: It is okay to call him whenever you want.
You cannot call him in the evening.
You can only write him emails.
He will never answer your call.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says it is possible to call at any time. Option 1 has the same meaning; the other options limit or stop calling.

tasks.audioText: You are on holiday in a small village. From your hotel window, you see something beautiful. We can see the mountains from here.
tasks.transcript: We can see the mountains from here.

options.text: It is possible to see the mountains from this place.
We cannot see any mountains from here.
We can see only the sea from here.
We can drive to the mountains today.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says the mountains are visible from here. Option 1 repeats this idea; the other options say we cannot see mountains or talk about going there.

tasks.audioText: Emma has weak eyes at night. She feels nervous when she drives in the dark. She can't drive at night.

options.text: She is able to drive at night.
She cannot drive when it is dark.
She only drives at night.
She likes to walk at night.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says she cannot drive at night. Option 2 has the same meaning; the other options say she can drive then or talk about walking.

tasks.audioText: A man enters a busy train. Many seats are full. He points to the seat next to you. Can I sit here?

options.text: He asks if it is okay to sit in this seat.
He tells you to stand up right now.
He asks you to move to another train.
He says you cannot sit in this seat.

tasks.explanation: The sentence is a question for permission to sit. Option 1 explains this; the other options talk about standing up, moving, or not sitting.

tasks.audioText: Leo is at a family party with his guitar. He plays many songs for his cousins. He can play the guitar very well.
tasks.transcript: He can play the guitar very well.

options.text: He knows how to play the guitar very well.
He cannot play the guitar at all.
He only listens to other people play guitar.
He can only play piano, not guitar.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says he can play guitar very well. Option 1 repeats this ability; the other options say he cannot play or plays another instrument.

tasks.audioText: Two friends talk about a music concert tomorrow. They are both busy with work and family. They can't go to the concert tomorrow.
tasks.transcript: They can't go to the concert tomorrow.

options.text: They are able to go to the concert tomorrow.
They are not able to go to the concert tomorrow.
They went to the concert yesterday.
They go to this concert every year.

tasks.explanation: The sentence says they cannot go to the concert tomorrow. Option 2 has the same meaning; the other options say they can go or talk about other times.

short_description: Понимайте на слух конструкции can и can't в повседневных ситуациях.
